speakerBioSummary.text:
• Bobby Lee has TV credits that include Netflix’s “Love,” Viceland’s “What Would Diplo Do?” and “Curb Your Enthusiasm”
  • Film credits include “The Dictator,” “Pineapple Express” and “Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle”
  • Voiced Tim/Sumo in Hulu’s “The Awesomes”
  • Cast member on “Mad TV,” frequent guest on “Chelsea Lately”

speakerBiography.text: Bobby Lee is best known from his numerous years as a cast member on Mad TV and as regular guest on E!’s Chelsea Lately. Bobby also starred on the NBC show Animal Practice. He has also been touring the country year-round with his hilariously unpredictable stand-up. Lee's film credits include The Dictator, Pineapple Express and Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle. On TV, Lee appeared in Curb Your Enthusiasm, and has performed stand-up on Premium Blend and The Tonight Show. Most recently, Lee voiced 'Tim/Sumo' in the Hulu original series The Awesomes, is a recurring guest on DVDASA as well as Netflix's Love, which has just been renewed for a third season, and stars in several national commercials such as Bookings.com.

relatedSpeakers.name: Colin Jost
relatedSpeakers.speakerNameSubheading: Head Writer, Saturday Night Live & Co-Anchor, "Weekend Update"

relatedSpeakers.name: Trevor Noah
relatedSpeakers.speakerNameSubheading: Emmy Award-Winning Comedian Known for Hosting The Daily Show​​​​
